Package org.anarres.jdiagnostics Description

Environment metadata for debugging and building support bundles. This package contains two primary utilities: ProductMetadata and Query.

ProductMetadata

ProductMetadata is an interface to build metadata stored in the JAR files of all your projects. You can implement a --version command-line flag as System.out.println(new ProductMetadata()); Of course it has a great many other accessors for querying available modules and versions.

Query

Query and DefaultQuery are a failure-avoidant way to dump a great deal of diagnostic information about the current environment, and detect many common configuration errors. A DefaultQuery Result is an essential part of any support bundle. You can also construct a DefaultQuery with a Throwable, and the Result will contain a verbose stack trace of the Throwable with all build and classpath metadata included. Basic usage is: Query q = new DefaultQuery(); System.out.println(q.call().toString()); although most applications will want to write the result data to a file or network rather than to the console.
